bill_title: prohibit the state health plan from paying for health care services provided out-of-state except in certain cases.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the state health plan from paying for health care services provided out-of-state except in certain cases. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 3-12A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The health insurance plan may not cover any service performed out-of-state unless: (1) The service is not available in the state; or (2) The service is required for an emergency occurring outside the state. The provisions of this section do not apply to any retired employee insured pursuant to § 3- 12A-18 who lives outside the state. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
